org.ingatan.data
Class TableQuestion

java.lang.Object
  org.ingatan.data.TableQuestion
All Implemented Interfaces:
IQuestion
public class TableQuestion
extends java.lang.Object
implements IQuestion

This is an implementation of the IQuestion interface. This class encapsulates the data associated with the table question field. The table question type is ideal for vocabulary training and other flash-card style learning exercises (trig identities, anyone?). The question is made up of a table, with some options regarding whether or not the question and answer column are reversible and whether the questions should be asked as auto-generated multiple choice or written, etc.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham

Field Detail

WRITTEN

public static final int WRITTEN
In the written type of question, the user will be provided with a text field in which to type an answer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MULTI_CHOICE

public static final int MULTI_CHOICE
In the multiple choice type of question, the user will be asked to select the correct answer from a randomly generated selection of 5 other answers taken from the opposite column of data.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RANDOM

public static final int RANDOM
Both written and multiple choice type questions will be used at random.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

questionTemplateFwd

protected java.lang.String questionTemplateFwd
The user can write a template question for the set of data, using placeholders for the table entries. For example 'translate [col1] from english to swedish'.

questionTemplateBwd

protected java.lang.String questionTemplateBwd
The user can write a template question for the set of data, using placeholders for the table entries. For example 'translate [col1] from english to swedish'. This field may need to be different to questionTemplateFwd when asking the question in reverse.

col1Data

protected java.lang.String[] col1Data
Column 1's data.

col2Data

protected java.lang.String[] col2Data
Column 2's data.

askInReverse

protected boolean askInReverse
Whether or not the questions can be asked in reverse, i.e. column 2 as the question.

quizMethod

protected int quizMethod
One of the fields of this class. Can be WRITTEN, MULTIPLE_CHOICE, or RANDOM. Indicates how the questions in the table will be asked.

marksAwarded

protected int[] marksAwarded
The sum of marks that have been awarded over all the times each question has been asked. The overall correctness of this question can be calculated as marksAwarded/marksAvailable.

marksAvailable

protected int[] marksAvailable
The sum of marks that have been available over all the times each question has been asked. The overall correctness of this question can be calculated as marksAwarded/marksAvailable. The reason this field is saved is that the user may wish to change the number of marks allocated for a particular answer field, without affecting the correctness value acheived thus far.

marksPerCorrectAnswer

protected int marksPerCorrectAnswer
The number of marks to award for each correct answer.

timesAsked

protected int[] timesAsked
The number of times a question has been asked based on this table of questions.

parentLibrary

protected java.lang.String parentLibrary
The libraryID of the library that this question belongs to.

fontFamilyName

protected java.lang.String fontFamilyName
The font to use for this table question.

fontSize

protected int fontSize
The font size to display the questions at during quiz time.

Constructor Detail

TableQuestion

public TableQuestion(java.lang.String parent,
                     java.lang.String questionTemplateFwd,
                     java.lang.String questionTemplateBwd,
                     java.lang.String[] col1Data,
                     java.lang.String[] col2Data,
                     boolean askInReverse,
                     int quizMethod,
                     java.lang.String fontName,
                     int fontSize,
                     int[] marksAwarded,
                     int[] marksAvailable,
                     int marksPerCorrectAnswer,
                     int[] timesAsked)
Creats a new TableQuestion object.

Parameters:
parent - the parent library of this question.
questionTemplateFwd - the question template when the question is asked forwards (col1 as question, col2 as answer)
questionTemplateBwd - the question template when the question is asked backwards (col1 as answer, col2 as question)
col1Data - the data contained by column 1
col2Data - the data contained by column 2
askInReverse - whether or not it is okay to ask these questions in reverse (i.e. col1 as the answer, col2 as the question)
quizMethod - the answer field types to use for this table question - generate multiple choice, written answers, or use both randomly.
marksAwarded - how many marks have been awarded for each entry
marksAvailable - the marks available for each entry
marksPerCorrectAnswer - the number of marks to award for each correct answer.
timesAsked - the number of times each entry has been asked.
Method Detail

isAskInReverse

public boolean isAskInReverse()
Gets whether or not ask in reverse is set to being allowed. Ask in reverse allows the second column of data to be framed as the question, as well as the other way around. This is interchanged randomly.

Returns:
whether or not ask in reverse is allowed.

setAskInReverse

public void setAskInReverse(boolean askInReverse)
Set whether or not ask in reverse is allowed. Ask in reverse allows the second column of data to be framed as the question, as well as the other way around. This is interchanged randomly.

Parameters:
askInReverse - true if ask in reverse should be allowed.

getQuestionTemplateFwd

public java.lang.String getQuestionTemplateFwd()
Gets the question template associated with this table question. The question template uses placeholders for the question and answer taken from the column data arrays. An example is Translate [placeholder] from English to Swedish.

Returns:
the question template associated with this table question.

validateArrays

public void validateArrays()
In the library editor, the column 1 and column 2 data arrays are updated with the gui content just before they are writen to the library file. This method updates the marksAwarded, marksAvailable, and timesAsked arrays so that they are the same size as column 1 and column 2. It also ensures that column 1 and column 2 are the same size so as to avoid possible errors, and that any empty entries into either column 1 or 2 are recorded appropriately.

setQuestionTemplateFwd

public void setQuestionTemplateFwd(java.lang.String questionTemplate)
Sets the question template associated with this table question. The question template uses placeholders for the question and answer taken from the column data arrays. An example is Translate [placeholder] from English to Swedish.

Parameters:
questionTemplate - the question template associated with this table question.

getQuestionTemplateBwd

public java.lang.String getQuestionTemplateBwd()
Gets the question template associated with this table question. The question template uses placeholders for the question and answer taken from the column data arrays. An example is Translate [placeholder] from English to Swedish. This is the backward template used when the ask in reverse setting is true.

Returns:
the question template associated with this table question.

setQuestionTemplateBwd

public void setQuestionTemplateBwd(java.lang.String questionTemplate)
Sets the question template associated with this table question. The question template uses placeholders for the question and answer taken from the column data arrays. An example is Translate [placeholder] from English to Swedish. This is the backward template, used when the ask in reverse setting is true.

Parameters:
questionTemplate - the question template associated with this table question.

getQuizMethod

public int getQuizMethod()
Gets the quiz method that should be used at quiz time for this table. The currently supported methods are 'written', where the user types the answer in a text field, 'multiple choice' where the user is presented with several possible responses automatically taken from the table of data, or 'random' where both of the aforementioned modes are used interchangably.

Returns:
the quiz method that should be used at quiz time for this table. See the fields of this class; WRITTEN, MULTI_CHOICE, and RANDOM.

setQuizMethod

public void setQuizMethod(int quizMethod)
Sets the quiz method that should be used at quiz time for this table. The currently supported methods are 'written', where the user types the answer in a text field, 'multiple choice' where the user is presented with several possible responses automatically taken from the table of data, or 'random' where both of the aforementioned modes are used interchangably.

Parameters:
quizMethod - one of the fields of this class; WRITTEN, MULTI_CHOICE, or RANDOM.

getTimesAsked
